description.en: Adds support for Remotec Technologies Z-wave devices

hint.en: This card will only get triggered if the button and scene match the state of the dropdown fields.
hint.nl: Deze kaart wordt alleen geactiveerd wanneer de knop en scene overeenkomen met de toestand van de gekozen opties.

hint.en: This card will trigger on any button pressed and provides the button and scene tokens.
hint.nl: Deze kaart wordt geactiveerd bij iedere knop die ingedrukt wordt en biedt de knop en scene tokens aan.

title.en: Set a setpoint of a thermostat mode
title.nl: Stel de temperatuur in van een thermostaat modus

hint.en: Change the setpoint of a specific thermostat mode. Note: does NOT activate this mode
hint.nl: Stel de temperatuur in van een thermostaat modus. Let op: activeert deze modus niet

instruction.en: Press the “L” button at the rear side of the Scene Master to add the device into the Z-Wave network.
instruction.nl: Druk de “L” knop aan de achterzijde van de Scene Master in om het apparaat toe te voegen aan het Z-wave netwerk.

instruction.en: Press the “L” button, at the rear side of the Scene Master, to remove the device from the Z-Wave network.
instruction.nl: Druk de “L” knop, aan de achterzijde van de Scene Master, in om het apparaat te verwijderen uit het Z-wave netwerk.

hint.en:
Z-Wave Plus Lifeline: Association Group 1 will be a default scene report channel. Only one node can be assigned to this association group. 
Default: 1 (Homey's ID)
hint.nl:
Z-Wave Plus Lifeline: Association Groep 1 wordt gebruikt om scene rapportages door te geven. Slechts een node kan toegevoegd worden aan deze associatie groep. 
Standaard: 1 (Homey's ID)

instruction.en: Triple click the button on the ZXT-120

hint.en: Define if air conditioner fan “SWING” mode should be enabled or not
This parameter is used to compensate the temperature error at temperature sensor

label.en: Set IR Code Number from built-in code library

hint.en: Refer to Code Finder Webpage
Range 0 (normal power mode) to 255 (high power mode (default))

Note: If more than one air conditioners with the same code set are used in the same room, user can disable the built-in IR emitter and use the external IR emitter cable to control each air conditioner individually

This parameter (25) is during the process to learning non-standard IR codes. Follow the steps as mentioned in the manual. If you need to learn another command, select the command from the dropdown list, press save and learn the command (press the button on the remote)
IR code learning status of manually learned codes.
Set polling interval Thermostat Mode (minutes), 0 = disabled, default = 120 minutes
Set polling interval Thermostat Setpoint (minutes), 0 = disabled, default = 180 minutes
Set polling interval Thermostat Fan Mode (minutes), 0 = disabled, default = 0
Set polling interval Temperature measurements (minutes), 0 = disabled, default = 0 minutes (disabled)
Byte 1, Model suffix, Byte 2, Reserved, Byte 3 & 4 : Library Version

instruction.en:
note:	 ZXT-600 will detect upon inclusion the applied power source (battery or USB-powered) to decide what Z-Wave device role it will use (battery= sleeping device, USB power = always awake device)
1.	Refer to your primary controller to enter into the Inclusion Mode or Exclusion Mode
2.	When it is prompted to enter it, please triple click the “PROG” button within 1 second.
3.	Green Indicator flashes TWICE then stay off

1.	Refer to your primary controller to enter into the Inclusion Mode or Exclusion Mode
2.	When it is prompted to enter it, please triple click the “PROG” button within 1 second.
3.	Green Indicator flashes TWICE then stay off

hint.en: Association Group #1 (max. 1 node) is default Z-wave lifeline group to associate with Homey for AC Master Status change report
Define if air conditioner fan “SWING” mode should be enabled or not

0(0x00) = Disable (Default)
(for saving battery life)
Auto report if room temperature is different from last report.
1(0x01) = 1°F (0.5°C)
2(0x02) = 2°F (1°C) 
3(0x03) = 3°F (1.5°C)
4(0x04) = 4°F (2°C)
5(0x05) = 5°F (2.5°C)
6(0x06) = 6°F (3°C)
7(0x07) = 7°F (3.5°C)
8(0x08) = 8°F (4°C)

Auto report by the following time interval.
1(0x01) = 1 Hr
2(0x02) = 2 Hrs
3(0x03) = 3 Hrs
4(0x04) = 4 Hrs
5(0x05) = 5 Hrs
6(0x06) = 6 Hrs
7(0x07) = 7 Hrs
8(0x08) = 8 Hrs   (Default)

label.en: Set IR Code Number from built-in code library

hint.en: Refer to Code Finder Webpage

Note: If more than one air conditioners with the same code set are used in the same room, user can disable the built-in IR emitter and use the external IR emitter cable to control each air conditioner individually

This parameter (25) is during the process to learning non-standard IR codes. Follow the steps as mentioned in the manual. If you need to learn another command, select the command from the dropdown list, press save and learn the command (press the button on the remote)
IR code learning status of manually learned codes.
Set polling interval Thermostat Mode (minutes), 0 = disabled, default = 120 minutes
Set polling interval Thermostat Setpoint (minutes), 0 = disabled, default = 180 minutes
Set polling interval Thermostat Fan Mode (minutes), 0 = disabled, default = 0
Byte 1, Model suffix, Byte 2, Reserved, Byte 3 & 4 : Library Version (read only)
